text:
Would you mind logging this as an issue? I don’t want this to get lost to Slack,

- <https://github.com/JuliaCloud/AWS.jl/issues/new>

There’s definitely something that can be done here, and it *shouldn’t* be too involved. I don’t have experience with API gateway, but I figured there would have been endpoints where you would just pass in `api_id`, `stage_name`, `route_name` and have it all constructed for you, but it doesn’t seem to be the case.

This also does lend into the areas of AWSS3 and various other hand written packages and to maybe reconsider how they tie into the ecosystem. Whether that’s as their own packages, or bringing them into `AWS.jl`.

text: btw, is anything I wrote in that code snippet using an internal API? My plan is to use that code moving forward and I want to make sure I am using AWS.jl correctly.

elements.text: btw, is anything I wrote in that code snippet using an internal API? My plan is to use that code moving forward and I want to make sure I am using AWS.jl correctly.

text:
Nope! You can trim off a few things from your `AWS.Request()` object though, as there are some default values in the object itself

```request = AWS.Request(
           service = "execute-api",
           api_version = "",
           request_method = "GET",
           headers = LittleDict([
               "Content-Type" => "application/json",
               "x-api-key" => api_key,
           ]),
           content = json(""),
           resource = "$(stage)/$route",
           url = "https://$(api_id).execute-api.$(aws_config.region).<http://amazonaws.com/$(stage)/$route|amazonaws.com/$(stage)/$route>",
           )```

elements.text: Nope! You can trim off a few things from your
object though, as there are some default values in the object itself

request = AWS.Request(
           service = "execute-api",
           api_version = "",
           request_method = "GET",
           headers = LittleDict([
               "Content-Type" => "application/json",
               "x-api-key" => api_key,
           ]),
           content = json(""),
           resource = "$(stage)/$route",
           url = "https://$(api_id).execute-api.$(aws_config.region).amazonaws.com/$(stage)/$route",
           )
